3b9355be3fa1ed0e45a73cc9791603be72862293.summary: Fix TileMaps with origin offset placing NavPolygons wrong without a Navigation2D node
3b9355be3fa1ed0e45a73cc9791603be72862293.body:
The legacy navigation was positioning baked TileMap navpolygons relative to the current Navigation2D node assuming that it is usually one of the parent nodes.

Without the deprecated Navigation2D node the default navigation map of the world_2d is used. This navigation map has no relative Node2D so it needs to use the global_transform of the TileMap to place navregions with the correct offset in case the TileMap is moved from the origin.

(cherry picked from commit 881e49c375f126987aa57528d6f8ef70462869c6)

881e49c375f126987aa57528d6f8ef70462869c6.summary: Fix TileMaps with origin offset placing NavPolygons wrong without a Navigation2D node
881e49c375f126987aa57528d6f8ef70462869c6.body:
The legacy navigation was positioning baked TileMap navpolygons relative to the current Navigation2D node assuming that it is usually one of the parent nodes.

Without the deprecated Navigation2D node the default navigation map of the world_2d is used. This navigation map has no relative Node2D so it needs to use the global_transform of the TileMap to place navregions with the correct offset in case the TileMap is moved from the origin.

This uninitialized data was finding its way into the renderer.

(cherry picked from commit fa4a32518073c5206c132c8f289a6750fce7a981)

fa4a32518073c5206c132c8f289a6750fce7a981.body: This uninitialized data was finding its way into the renderer.

28800cfb23d3c8090c7014c74609e92839e45b60.body:
Found by Valgrind.

(cherry picked from commit c254e97c6b376f035235559f7f46158167f80d21)

5800615be7a8388e6f8eef0a64c66a28f12aa2ff.body:
Valgrind was showing a read from uninitialized memory. r_fill_state.curr_batch->color is unset (for performance reasons), so can contain random data.

This actually doesn't matter in practice, since logically this uninitialized state can only occur when change_batch is set, and the only side effect is that change_batch is set. Hence why no bugs occur in practice.

This PR prevents this read from uninitialized data. It is likely free in terms of performance after optimization, and keeps the Valgrind logs clearer, so why not.

(cherry picked from commit 23fedc0d1a5b65592c2381322d7702007a6d849b)

23fedc0d1a5b65592c2381322d7702007a6d849b.body:
Valgrind was showing a read from uninitialized memory. r_fill_state.curr_batch->color is unset (for performance reasons), so can contain random data.

This actually doesn't matter in practice, since logically this uninitialized state can only occur when change_batch is set, and the only side effect is that change_batch is set. Hence why no bugs occur in practice.

This PR prevents this read from uninitialized data. It is likely free in terms of performance after optimization, and keeps the Valgrind logs clearer, so why not.

465a6569e43d5dd13be47db1a039ff3664d42c0f.summary: C#: Use custom project setting for C# project files name
465a6569e43d5dd13be47db1a039ff3664d42c0f.body:
The setting is initially assigned the name of the Godot project,
but it's kept freezed to prevent issues when renaming the Godot
project.

The user can always rename the C# project and solution manually and
change the setting to the new name.

Co-authored-by: Ignacio Roldán Etcheverry <ignalfonsore@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 31d09a807efc973222016a47f832f590c51949ef)

a7a8f9c85d8ad7140c96f957a34821db0600c02f.summary: Fix issue preventing the Android Editor from displaying the project content
a7a8f9c85d8ad7140c96f957a34821db0600c02f.body:
The issue was causing by a bug within the logic for `FileAccessFilesystemJAndroid#eof_reached()` causing that value to remain false after the eof was reached.
This in turn caused an infinite loop in the file scanner preventing the project's content from showing up.

(cherry picked from commit 30479543b07d5869eb024663c6588e608bee3c1b)

30479543b07d5869eb024663c6588e608bee3c1b.summary: Fix issue preventing the Android Editor from displaying the project content
30479543b07d5869eb024663c6588e608bee3c1b.body:
The issue was causing by a bug within the logic for `FileAccessFilesystemJAndroid#eof_reached()` causing that value to remain false after the eof was reached.
This in turn caused an infinite loop in the file scanner preventing the project's content from showing up.

f0d7931de611822161467b9f6fd0239a5ec221da.summary: Don't process input in hidden EditorProperty.
f0d7931de611822161467b9f6fd0239a5ec221da.body:
This causes EditorProperty nodes to intercept input events even when the
Editor Properties dialog is not visible. This means that after closing
the dialog, ctrl+shift+c will still copy the last selected property
path.

Fixes #62866.

(cherry picked from commit 26223fe8553c1c623be8b5aaad2ccf31ee5948d3)

26223fe8553c1c623be8b5aaad2ccf31ee5948d3.summary: Don't process input in hidden EditorProperty.
26223fe8553c1c623be8b5aaad2ccf31ee5948d3.body:
This causes EditorProperty nodes to intercept input events even when the
Editor Properties dialog is not visible. This means that after closing
the dialog, ctrl+shift+c will still copy the last selected property
path.

Fixes #62866.

6426f2e9c79e5dd653458f3cb07da80c09ec1fe4.summary: Change code folding behavior to include terminal indented comments
6426f2e9c79e5dd653458f3cb07da80c09ec1fe4.body:
Previously, when folding a block of code that finished with an indented comment (i.e. one indented as much as or more than the starting indent of the code), that comment would be left out of the fold. Change the behavior to include such comments, but still leave less-indented ones out.

(cherry picked from commit efed5087ae75a13e58cc06da5323f6f6448819a4)

efed5087ae75a13e58cc06da5323f6f6448819a4.summary: Change code folding behavior to include terminal indented comments
efed5087ae75a13e58cc06da5323f6f6448819a4.body: Previously, when folding a block of code that finished with an indented comment (i.e. one indented as much as or more than the starting indent of the code), that comment would be left out of the fold. Change the behavior to include such comments, but still leave less-indented ones out.

b00758fe182c76a7dae03096470295ff1f907e62.summary: doc: Clarify `MultiMesh.set_instance_color` re: white albedo color
b00758fe182c76a7dae03096470295ff1f907e62.body:
If the user does not set the albedo color to pure white, then the
multiplication with a value different from 1 will produce modulated colors.

Co-authored-by: Hugo Locurcio <hugo.locurcio@hugo.pro>
